title: Axiom Constraint Validation Domain (ACVD) Policy Schema
description: Defines externalized constraints governing P-01 calculus, DSE parameters, and GSEP operational controls, guaranteeing deterministic configuration baseline (S01).

ACVD_VERSION.description: Semantic versioning of the ACVD schema payload (e.g., V94.1).

POLICY_METADATA.description: Descriptive and administrative metadata for traceability and deployment control.

POLICY_ID.description: Unique identifier for this specific ACVD configuration set (e.g., 'ACVD-PROD-V94-S01').

CREATION_DATE.description: Timestamp indicating when the policy configuration was finalized.

IS_MANDATORY_BASELINE.description: If TRUE, this policy cannot be overridden by dynamic environment variables or local flags, enforcing S01 baseline integrity.

P01_CRITERIA.description: Constraints directly dictating the P-01 PASS/FAIL resolution. All nested parameters are mandatory.

AXIOM_I_UTILITY.description: Constraints for system efficacy (TEMM) and utility debt (ADTM).

MIN_EFFICACY_THRESHOLD_OMEGA.description: Minimum TEMM score (Î©_min) required for P-01 PASS (0.0 < x < 1.0).

MAX_ALLOWABLE_UTILITY_DEBT_LOGS.description: Maximum permissible ADTM logs within a cycle before Integrity Halt (IH).

AXIOM_II_CONTEXT.description: Constraints related to temporal context resolution (ECVM).

ECVM_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT_MS.description: Maximum time allowed (in milliseconds) for ECVM state resolution before IH.

AXIOM_III_INTEGRITY.description: Constraints focused on core operational integrity (MPAM).

ENFORCE_ZERO_MPAM_VIOLATIONS.description: If TRUE, any MPAM entry triggers an automatic P-01 FAIL, enforcing zero-tolerance governance. Renamed for clarity.

DSE_PARAMETERS.description: Dynamic State Efficacy (DSE) parameters influencing configuration sensitivity and deviation tolerance.

MAX_STATE_DEVIATION_QUOTA_PCT.description: Maximum allowed deviation percentage from the codified target state (S01 baseline) before triggering DSE alerts.

STATE_CHANGE_LOCK_TIMEOUT_MS.description: Duration (ms) for which the system maintains a change lock during self-modification protocols (SCP).

GSEP_BEHAVIOR.description: Operational constraints for the GSEP-C execution and failure protocols.

IH_IMMEDIATE_ROLLBACK_REQUIRED.description: If TRUE, Integrity Halt (IH) triggers mandatory Rollback Protocol (RRP) instantly.

IH_MAX_RRP_ATTEMPTS_BEFORE_FREEZE.description: Maximum number of RRP attempts before the system enters a hard freeze/manual inspection state. Parameter renamed for specificity (RRP).
